fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An editorial that discussed the relationship between the Hungarian-born financier George Soros and the Hungarian government referred to “Mr Soros’s Central European University”. The Budapest-based university says Soros founded the CEU and is a major funder, but it is not his and he is not involved in running it (Poland and Hungary are both heading in the wrong direction, 19 July, page 26). • We called Barry Quirk both the former chief executive of Lewisham council and the new chief executive of Kensington and Chelsea in an article about Grenfell Tower fire survivors speaking at a recent council meeting. Quirk has been working for Kensington and Chelsea council on an interim basis while a replacement chief officer is identified and appointed, and he remains chief executive of Lewisham council (Fire survivors call on council leader to quit during chaotic town hall meeting, 20 July, page 14). • Homophone corner: “We are on this enormous growth trajectory – there is no end in site of the rate of this growth” (Stark warning over global risk of boom in plastic pollution, 20 July, page 6). • Other recently corrected articles include: Daniel Kitson can’t reclaim a racist word he’s never been the target of ‘Close to the sheds, the smell is overpowering’: inside a UK mega farm Churchill tried to suppress Nazi plot to restore Edward VIII to British throne
